title: APT ORB / encyclo logo of communism

dialogueTree.title: Encyclopedia: "That isn't *just* a five-pointed st..."
dialogueTree.text: That isn't *just* a five-pointed star -- it's an inverted white pentagram cradled in a wreath of antlers. The iconography of communism, in other words.

links.title: You: ""Look out, Kim: There are communist..."
links.text: "Look out, Kim: There are communists around here."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'll keep my Armistice handy, dete..."
links.text: "I'll keep my Armistice handy, detective."

links.title: Rhetoric: "He doesn't actually reach for his g..."
links.text: He doesn't actually reach for his gun.

links.title: You: "Inspect the symbol closer."
links.text: Inspect the symbol closer.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The star-and-antlers was developed..."
links.text: The star-and-antlers was developed in the sixth decade of the last century and quickly adopted by Mazov and the communards during the Revolution...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Even today, half a century after, t..."
links.text: Even today, half a century after, the star-and-antlers retains the ability to evoke hope, disappointment, and fear in equal measure.

links.title: You: "Why is the star upside down?"
links.text: Why is the star upside down?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "To symbolize the toppling of the ol..."
links.text: To symbolize the toppling of the old order.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Also, some social democrats were al..."
links.text: Also, some social democrats were already using it.

links.title: You: "What's the deal with the antlers?"
links.text: What's the deal with the antlers?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The wreath of antlers represents a..."
links.text: The wreath of antlers represents a natural crown. It was about building a society that could exist in accord with the natural world -- and at the same time above it.

links.title: You: "Why white?"
links.text: Why white?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Because white is the colour of peac..."
links.text: Because white is the colour of peace.

links.title: You: "What does it evoke in me? [Finish t..."
links.text: What does it evoke in me? [Finish thought.]

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Gone. Gone is the glory. Of hope, o..."
links.text: Gone. Gone is the glory. Of hope, only the scribblings of impoverished students remain. In dirty hallways...

links.title: Rhetoric: "You are the Big Communism Builder n..."
links.text: You are the Big Communism Builder now. It's you or no one.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You see noble aims but also mountai..."
links.text: You see noble aims but also mountains upon mountains of corpses. They should've taken a more *measured* approach. Also, you're really smart.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The price of idealism unrestrained..."
links.text: The price of idealism unrestrained by humanism. Never again.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Communism is the ideology of gutles..."
links.text: Communism is the ideology of gutless intellectuals and clueless university students. They don't care about the *real* wörking man.

links.title: Endurance: "In other words, it doesn't mean a t..."
links.text: In other words, it doesn't mean a thing to *trüe* Revacholians.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Smug superiority? Esthetic musings?..."
links.text: Smug superiority? Esthetic musings? The triumph of Capital is undeniable, but... maybe the guns were sort of cool? Revolutionaries had loads of guns.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Whatever kid drew this graffito wil..."
links.text: Whatever kid drew this graffito will get it one day. You just can't beat FREEDOM and hustle-jiggling all the time.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Nothing at all yet. Right now it's..."
links.text: Nothing at all yet. Right now it's just meaningless shapes on a wall.

links.title: You: "[Discard thought.]"
links.text: [Discard thought.]
